item.title: abduction
item.description: when the [[vocal folds|vocal cords]]

item.title: adduction
item.description: when body parts come towards the middle of the body in the case of [[vocal folds|vocal cords]] → they close

item.title: allele
item.description: dominant or recessive

item.title: articulators
item.description: [[tongue]], cheeks, jaw

item.title: attack and decay

item.title: Bernoulli effect
item.description: $$\underbrace{ P_{1} }{ \text{Pressure Energy} }+\underbrace{ \frac{1}{2}pv^{2}{1} }{ \text{Kinetic Energy per unit volume} }+ \underbrace{ pgh{1} }{ \text{Potential Energy per unit volume} }=P{2}+\frac{1}{2}pv^{2}{1}+pgh{2}$$

item.title: boom carpet
item.description: the narrow path where the sonic boom may be heard affecting factors include altitude of aircraft and angle $\alpha$

item.title: dihybrid cross
item.description: the inheritance of two different traits controlled by two different genes [!info] Labrador retrievers’ fur color relationship of 2 genes with dominant-recessive inheritance

item.title: DNA

item.title: Doppler effect
item.description: Basic principle when a source is stationary, waves propagate from it with a uniform frequency in all directions when a source is moving in a medium, the waves in the direction of its movement are generated closer together (the relative velocity of the wave and source is lower) → higher frequency

item.title: doppler spectroscopy
item.description: measures the “wobble” of stars caused by their exoplanets (or another star) using the periodic variations in the color of light a star emits

item.title: DORIS
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: epistasis
item.description: type of genetic interaction where the phenotype is dependent on the presence or absence of one or more other genes

item.title: Fourier analysis

item.title: gamete
item.description: [[sperm]] or egg cells → contain half of genetic information

item.title: genes
item.description: segment of [[DNA]] that encodes for a functional [[RNA]] or protein product, which determines the traits and characteristics of living organisms

item.title: genetics
item.description: [[genes]] interact to create traits → [[epistasis]] an offspring inherits a [[genotype]] from parents’ [[gamete|gametes]]

item.title: genotype
item.description: the genetic background of a [[phenotype]] or other characteristic of an organism

item.title: harmonic content
item.description: determined by [[Fourier analysis]]

item.title: human sound
item.description: Three components lungs [[vocal folds]] (within [[larynx]]) [[articulators]] Voice type affected by the size of the [[vocal folds|vocal cords]] and [[vocal tract]]

item.title: Human sound creation
item.description: during [[phonation]], [[vocal folds|vocal cords]] become closed by arytenoid cartilages vocal cords are forced apart by positive air pressure low air pressure closes them yet again ([[Bernoulli effect]]) the frequency of the bursts of air determine the frequency of the [[sound]]

item.title: larynx
item.description: contains 5 cartilages and [[vocal folds|vocal cords]] upper cartilage is the epiglottis biggest is the [[thyroid cartilage]]

item.title: lift
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: loudness
item.description: depends on the amount of energy that started the [[waves]] the farther from the source, the more spread out the energy becomes

item.title: Mach number
item.description: [!fail] This page does not exist (yet)!

item.title: N-wave
item.description: when travelling in a straight line high pressure at nose, low pressure at tail, normal pressure behind plane

item.title: phenotype
item.description: the observable physical or biochemical characteristics of an organism, resulting from the interaction of its [[genotype]] with the environment

item.title: phonation
item.description: energy from air pressure is converted into audible vibrations

item.title: Poiseuille’s law

item.title: quality
item.description: distinguishable characteristics of a tone determined by the [[harmonic content]] of a sound, [[attack and decay]], and [[vibrato]]

item.title: RNA

item.title: sex linked inheritance
item.description: refers to traits inherited through the [[X chromosome]] [!info] Calico cats’ fur [[genotype|Genotypes]] black male: $X^{b}Y$ orange male: $X^{B}Y$

item.title: Sonic boom
item.description: happens when a source travels faster than the [[speed of sound]] [!important] continuous phenomenon can be heard when the receiver intersects the “cone” of sound

item.title: speed of sound
item.description: at sealevel at 20°C: $$343\text{ m/s}$$
